body.p: This page contains information about the FreeBSD port to Fujitsu's SPARC64® and Oracle's UltraSPARC® architectures. Discussion of this port takes place on the freebsd-sparc mailing list.

UltraSPARC is a
Tier 2 architecture through FreeBSD 12.x. It is no longer supported in FreeBSD 13.0 and later.

A summary of supported systems follows. SMP is supported on all supported systems that contain more than 1 processor. For full details, please see the
hardware notes of the release you are using.

ul.li: Sun Fire B100s (support for the on-board NICs first appeared in 8.1-RELEASE)

body.p: These systems are partially supported by FreeBSD. In particular, the fibre channel controllers in SBus-based systems are not supported. However, it is possible to use these with a SCSI controller supported by the esp(4) driver (Sun ESP SCSI, Sun FAS Fast-SCSI and Sun FAS366 Fast-Wide SCSI controllers).
Starting with 7.2-RELEASE, sparc64 systems based on Sun UltraSPARC III and beyond are also supported by FreeBSD, which includes these known working systems:

ul.li: Sun Fire V215 (support first appeared in 7.3-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE)
Sun Fire V245 (support first appeared in 7.3-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE)
Sun Fire V440 (support for the on-board NICs first appeared in 7.3-RELEASE and 8.0-RELEASE)
Sun Fire V480 (501-6780 and 501-6790 centerplanes only, for which support first appeared in 7.3-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE, other centerplanes might work beginning with 8.3-RELEASE and 9.0-RELEASE)
Sun Fire V890 (support first appeared in 7.4-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE, non-mixed Ultrasparc IV/IV+ CPU-configurations only)

body.p: These Sun UltraSPARC systems are not tested but are believed to also be supported by FreeBSD:

ul.li: Sun Fire V490 (support first appeared in 7.4-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE, non-mixed Ultrasparc IV/IV+ CPU-configurations only)

body.p: Starting with 7.4-RELEASE and 8.1-RELEASE, sparc64 systems based on Fujitsu SPARC64 V are also supported by FreeBSD, which includes these known working systems:
These Fujitsu SPARC64 systems have not been tested but are believed to also be supported by FreeBSD:
If you have a system that is not listed here, please try it and let us know about it.
To subscribe to this list, send an email to <freebsd-sparc64-subscribe@FreeBSD.org> or visit the mailman interface.
